graphicslib3D
Interface ISurfacePatch

public interface ISurfacePatch

This interface specifies the methods which must be implemented by classes in order to be editable by the "SurfacePatchDialog" class. Generally the implementing class is some form of cubic Bezier surface patch represented by 16 control points whose values are stored in the object.

Implementing this interface allows an object to be cast into a form which can be passed to a SurfacePatchDialog object; that is, it allows any user-written object to use the SurfacePatchDialog editor to alter the contents of the object. See the SurfacePatchDialog class for a description of how to use the object-editing capabilities of that class.

Version:
4.3 02/23/06
Author:
John Clevenger

Method Detail

getPatchName

java.lang.String getPatchName()
Return the name of the surface patch.

setPatchName

void setPatchName(java.lang.String newName)
Specify a new name for the surface patch.

getControlMesh

ControlMesh getControlMesh()
Returns a ControlMesh containing the control points defining this surface patch. A ControlMesh is a 4x4 matrix of control points; each control point is a Point3D object.

setControlMesh

void setControlMesh(ControlMesh newMesh)
Specify a new ControlMesh for this surface patch. Defining a new control mesh effectively redefines the patch, since it is the contents of the control point array which are used to generate the patch representation.

getMaxRecursionLevel

int getMaxRecursionLevel()
Returns the current maximum recursion level (resolution) which is used to generate polygons representing this surface.

setMaxRecursionLevel

void setMaxRecursionLevel(int newLevel)
Specify a new recursion level to be used in generating polygons for this patch.
